SEARCH
Package com.alticelabs.ccp.exagon.api.protocol_mapper.zombie_session

Interface IExagonSessionValidityHandler

public interface IExagonSessionValidityHandler
An extensible specification used to enrich the ExagonInternalRequest with methods relevant for Exagon's Zombie Session Manager (ZSM).

The ZSM is a module that controls the sessions that no longer have network stimulus. A session whose last external event is older than the parameterized tolerance must be automatically and administratively terminated with an administrative session termination pseudo-event generated in the orchestrator via

invalid reference 
#createAdministrativeCloseSessionEvent
. This way, it is guaranteed that session contexts do not remain in the repository forever and that sessions are functionally closed.
Since:
5.0
See Also:
  • IExagonInternalRequest

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    MaxExpectedDelta
    getMaxExpectedDelta()
    Calculates the maximum expected horizon in which there must be a new stimulus (request) from the network for a given session.

  • Method Details

    • getMaxExpectedDelta

      MaxExpectedDelta getMaxExpectedDelta()
      Calculates the maximum expected horizon in which there must be a new stimulus (request) from the network for a given session. If this horizon is surpassed without any network stimulus, Exagon considers the session expired and forces its termination with an administrative session termination pseudo-event. This method is called internally by Exagon and used on its Zombie Session Manager (ZSM).
      Returns:
      a record containing the max expected horizon (delta) and the session identifier
